result.execSummary:
The defendant Nestor Daniel Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Under the Huber Law. 

Court deems the sentence time served.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nestor Daniel Lopez

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
3:40 PM Defendant Nestor Daniel Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Nestor Daniel Lopez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Count 1, Possession of THC (2nd+) No contest plea entered.  Convicted.  Court sentences defendant to thirty (30) days Manitowoc County Jail, under the Huber Law, court deems the sentence time served.  Court imposes costs of $518 to be paid by 12-06-2022 or 10 days jail for failure to pay.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:20 am.

2:11 PM Defendant Nestor Daniel Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah Malcore for Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Nestor Daniel Lopez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has had a change of heart and does not wish to waive his preliminary hearing today. The State has not made an inducement offer as they were informed it was going to be a waiver. Witnesses were also canceled. 
Court finds good cause to extend the time limits in which a preliminary hearing must be held. The State informs the court that Attorney Jaconi also represents the co-defendant. 
After further discussion, the defendant is willing to waive his right to preliminary hearing. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar. 
The defendant waives any conflict of interest with the representation of the co-defendant Rodolfo Vera-Perez (22CF268).
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on July 20, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.    Preliminary hearing is set for 05-16-22 at 2:00 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond by 04-29-22.   Court further orders defendant to report to MCSD for photo and prints.    
Minutes.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
